item.title: Enira add a quote by Milan Kundera
item.description: "You can't measure the mutual affection of two human beings by the number of words they exchange." -- Milan Kundera

item.title: Enira add a quote by Milan Kundera
item.description: "Love is the longing for the half of ourselves we have lost." -- Milan Kundera

item.title: Enira add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "If you only read the books that everyone else is reading, you can only think what everyone else is thinking." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Enira add a quote by Italo Calvino
item.description: "If one wanted to depict the whole thing graphically, every episode, with its climax, would require a three-dimensional, or, rather, no model: every experience is unrepeatable. What makes lovemaking and reading resemble each other most is that within both of them times and spaces open, different from measurable time and space." -- Italo Calvino
